events.1759: Alamgir was murdered by his minister Imad-ul-Mulk.
events.1858: Jagdish Chandra Bose, botonist and physics expert, was born at Mymensingh (now in Bangladesh).
events.1896: Gandhiji sails for South Africa with wife and children.
events.1915: Venkat Apparao Gurjad, famous Telgu poet, died.
events.1920: N. B. Kamat, filmmaker and distributor, was born.
events.1974: India, Pakistan decide to end the ten-year trade ban.
events.1982: World premier of Sir Richard Attenborough's 'Gandhi' held in New Delhi.
events.1986: Sikhs hijack bus, killing 24 at Punjab.
events.1988: Cyclone lashes Bangladesh, Eastern India; 317 killed.
events.1989: Congress (I) emerges largest party in Lok Sabha by winning 193 seats, Congress (I) rule in Karnataka and Veerendra Patil made the Chief Minister.
events.1990: Admiral Laxmi Narayan Ramdas takes over as Chief of Naval Staff.
events.1994: Mrinalini Desai, freedom fighter and famous litterateur, died.
events.1998: Sonia Gandhi names Ashok Ghelot and Sheila Dixit as Chief Ministers of Rajasthan and Delhi respectively.
events.1999: The disinvestment panel headed by G. V. Ramakrishna demits office after the end of its three-year term.
events.2000: Dr. Anil Kakodkar takes charge as Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission and Secretary, Department of Atomic Energy.
